HydraulicParticle.description: HydraulicParticle is a particle-based hydraulic erosion operator that simulates the erosion and sediment transport processes that occur due to the flow of water over a terrain represented by the input heightmap. HydraulicStream.description: HydraulicStream is an hydraulic erosion operator using the flow stream approach and an infinite flow direction algorithm for simulating the erosion processes. Simulate water flow across the terrain using the infinite flow direction algorithm. As water flows over the terrain, flow accumulation representing the volume of water that passes through each point on the map, is computed to evaluate the erosive power of the water flow.

HydraulicStreamLog.description: HydraulicStream is an hydraulic erosion operator using the flow stream approach and an infinite flow direction algorithm for simulating the erosion processes. Simulate water flow across the terrain using the infinite flow direction algorithm. As water flows over the terrain, flow accumulation representing the volume of water that passes through each point on the map, is computed to evaluate the erosive power of the water flow. Deposition is mimicked using convolution filters.
HydraulicStreamLog.label: HydraulicStreamLog

HydraulicVpipes.description: HydraulicVpipes performs hydraulic erosion using a virtual pipe algorithm, which is a method that simulates erosion and sediment transport processes by mimicking the behavior of water flowing through a network of virtual pipes. MountainRangeRadial.description: Generates a heightmap representing a radial mountain range emanating from a specified center.
MountainRangeRadial.label: MountainRangeRadial

angle_spread_ratio.description: Controls the angular spread of the mountain range. Lower values create more concentrated ridges, while higher values distribute them more evenly.
angle_spread_ratio.label: angle_spread_ratio

center.description: The center point of the radial mountain range as normalized coordinates within [0, 1].
center.label: center

core_size_ratio.description: Determines the relative size of the core mountain region before tapering begins.
core_size_ratio.label: core_size_ratio

half_width.description: Defines the half-width of the radial mountain range, controlling its spread.
half_width.label: half_width

inverse.description: Toggle inversion of the output values, flipping elevations.
inverse.label: inverse

kw.description: The wave numbers (frequency components) that define the base frequency of the noise function.
kw.label: kw

lacunarity.description: The frequency scaling factor for successive noise octaves. Higher values increase the frequency of each successive octave.
lacunarity.label: lacunarity

octaves.description: The number of octaves for fractal noise generation. More octaves add finer details to the terrain.
octaves.label: octaves

persistence.description: The amplitude scaling factor for subsequent noise octaves. Lower values reduce the contribution of higher octaves.
persistence.label: persistence

remap.description: Remaps the operator's output values to a specified range, defaulting to [0, 1].
remap.label: remap

post_gain.description: Set the gain. Gain is a power law transformation altering the distribution of signal values, compressing or expanding certain regions of the signal depending on the exponent of the power law.
post_gain.label: post_gain

post_inverse.description: Inverts the output values after processing, flipping low and high values across the midrange.
post_inverse.label: post_inverse

post_remap.description: Linearly remaps the output values to a specified target range (default is [0, 1]).
post_remap.label: post_remap

post_saturate.description: Modifies the amplitude of elevations by first clamping them to a given interval and then scaling them so that the restricted interval matches the original input range. This enhances contrast in elevation variations while maintaining overall structure.
post_saturate.label: post_saturate

post_smoothing_radius.description: Defines the radius for post-processing smoothing, determining the size of the neighborhood used to average local values and reduce high-frequency detail. A radius of 0 disables smoothing.
post_smoothing_radius.label: post_smoothing_radius

Path.description: A polyline defined by a series of connected points (x, y) with elevation data (z). Paths can represent linear features such as roads, rivers, or boundaries.
Path.label: Path

path.description: The sequence of points defining the path. Each point consists of coordinates (x, y) and an elevation (z).
path.label: path

path.caption: path
path.description: Outputs the path as a set of directed points (x, y) and elevations (z).

PathBezier.description: PathBezier uses Bezier interpolation to replace sharp angles and straight segments with smooth, flowing curves.
PathBezier.label: PathBezier

curvature_ratio.description: Amount of curvature (usually in [-1, 1] and commonly > 0).
curvature_ratio.label: curvature_ratio

edge_divisions.description: Edge sub-divisions of each edge. After the operation, the path is remeshed based on this new sub-division.
edge_divisions.label: edge_divisions

PathBezierRound.description: PathBezierRound uses Bezier interpolation to replace sharp angles and straight segments with smooth, round and flowing curves. PathBezierRound is an alternative to PathBezier.
PathBezierRound.label: PathBezierRound

curvature_ratio.description: Amount of curvature (usually in [-1, 1] and commonly > 0).

edge_divisions.description: Edge sub-divisions of each edge. After the operation, the path is remeshed based on this new sub-division.

edge_divisions.label: edge_divisions

PathFractalize.description: PathFractalize fractalizes a polyline using a mid-point displacement algorithm. The procedure involves iteratively modifying the polyline's geometry to increase its complexity, mimicking fractal characteristics.
PathFractalize.label: PathFractalize

orientation.description: Displacement orientation (0 for random inward/outward displacement, 1 to inflate the path and -1 to deflate the path).

sigma.description: Half-width of the random Gaussian displacement, normalized by the distance between points.
sigma.label: sigma

PathMeanderize.description: PathMeanderize uses Bezier interpolation to add menaders to the input path.

PathResample.description: PathResample resamples the path based to get (approximately) a given distance between points.
PathResample.label: PathResample

PathSDF.description: PathSDF evaluates the signed distance function of a polyline. It assigns a signed distance value to every point in space. For points outside the polyline, the distance is positive, while for points inside, it's negative. The zero level set of this function precisely defines the polyline's path Project path points to an heightmap.
PathSDF.label: PathSDF

remap.description: Target range: define the new minimum and maximum values to remap the elevation values to.
remap.label: remap

Rescale.description: The Rescale operator involves adjusting each data point by multiplying it with a predetermined constant.
Rescale.label: Rescale

centered.description: Determine whether a mean offset is applied to the values to center the scaling.
centered.label: centered

scaling.description: Constant by which each elevation values will be multiplied.
scaling.label: scaling

post_gain.description: Set the gain. Gain is a power law transformation altering the distribution of signal values, compressing or expanding certain regions of the signal depending on the exponent of the power law.
post_gain.label: post_gain

post_inverse.description: Inverts the output values after processing, flipping low and high values across the midrange.
post_inverse.label: post_inverse

post_mix.description: Mixing factor for blending input and output values. A value of 0 uses only the input, 1 uses only the output, and intermediate values perform a linear interpolation.
post_mix.label: post_mix

post_mix_method.description: Method used to combine input and output values. Options include linear interpolation (default), min, max, smooth min, smooth max, add, and subtract.
post_mix_method.label: post_mix_method

post_remap.description: Linearly remaps the output values to a specified target range (default is [0, 1]).
post_remap.label: post_remap

post_saturate.description: Modifies the amplitude of elevations by first clamping them to a given interval and then scaling them so that the restricted interval matches the original input range. This enhances contrast in elevation variations while maintaining overall structure.
post_saturate.label: post_saturate

post_smoothing_radius.description: Defines the radius for post-processing smoothing, determining the size of the neighborhood used to average local values and reduce high-frequency detail. A radius of 0 disables smoothing.
post_smoothing_radius.label: post_smoothing_radius

Ruggedness.description: Measures the terrain roughness by computing the square root of the sum of squared elevation differences within a specified radius. Indicates how rough or smooth the terrain is by analyzing how much the elevation changes between neighboring areas. Higher values mean a more rugged, uneven surface, while lower values indicate a flatter, smoother landscape.
Ruggedness.label: Ruggedness

SelectValley.description: Identifies and selects valley-like regions in the heightmap based on curvature analysis. The selection can be inverted, and additional parameters allow fine-tuning of the selection process. The output is a mask representing the relative width of the valley. The value is 1 at the valley center and decreases to 0 at the edges of the valley.
SelectValley.label: SelectValley

SetAlpha.description: SetAlpha adjusts the transparency of a texture based on an input alpha value, which can either be a single scalar or an array. When provided with a scalar alpha value, the function uniformly adjusts the transparency of the entire texture. Alternatively, when given an array of alpha values, it enables fine-grained control over the transparency of different parts of the texture, allowing for varied opacity across the texture's surface.
SetAlpha.label: SetAlpha

alpha.description: Transparency as a scalar value (overriden if this alpha input is set).
alpha.label: alpha

ShapeIndex.description: ShapeIndex is a measure used to quantify the shape complexity of landforms in an heightmap. It is calculated based on the second derivatives of the elevation surface. The surface index is greater than 0.5 for convex surface and lower than 0.5 for concave surface.
ShapeIndex.label: ShapeIndex

SharpenCone.description: SharpenCone is a cone kernel-based sharpen operator enhancing sharpness by emphasizing edges and fine details using a radial gradient shape.

post_gain.label: post_gain

post_inverse.description: Inverts the output values after processing, flipping low and high values across the midrange.
post_inverse.label: post_inverse

SmoothCpulse.description: Smoothing using a cubic pulse kernel can be considered somewhat similar to Gaussian smoothing. This technique is used to reduce noise and smooth data. The cubic pulse kernel has a cubic decrease in influence with distance within a finite interval. It is zero beyond a certain radius, providing a compact support that affects only nearby points.
SmoothCpulse.label: SmoothCpulse

It supports both periodic boundary conditions, where the array wraps around, and non-periodic conditions.

Vororand.description: This function computes a Voronoi diagram or derived metric (such as F1, F2, or edge distances) on a grid of given shape. A set of random points is generated within an extended bounding box, based on the desired density and variability, to reduce edge artifacts. Optionally, per-pixel displacement can be applied through noise fields. Optionnaly, a user-defined set of points can be used instead of automatically generated random points.
